Articles.Content: Hi! I started playing a few days ago, and in order not to waste time for landing on the moon (I have already landed on it manually several times), I installed the mechjeb 2 mod, once successfully used landing guidance, but then for some reason on the second flight and all subsequent ones this mode didn't appear in the list. I really need it for an accurate landing.  Does anyone know the reason why he disappeared?
Landing guidance is for spaceplanes only and only for landing on Kerbin Runways

Text from ksp wiki:

  • After you've entered the Mun's sphere of influence, open the Landing Autopilot from the MechJeb menu.
  • Ensure "Deploy Parachutes" is UNchecked.
  • Press Select target on the map and choose where you want to land.
  • Press Land at target. Alternatively, if you just want to land somewhere, press Land somewhere.
  • MechJeb will warp to the deorbit burn point.
  • Warp till 20000m (don't warp more than 3x).
  • Extend the gear once it says executing braking burn.

You have now landed on the Mun. You can now extend the ladder and EVA (optional). Go to step 5 to return to Kerbin.

On 4/29/2021 at 11:51 PM, Singhnaut said:

Landing guidance is for spaceplanes only and only for landing on Kerbin Runways

No.

I use it for most of my landings and I don't use spaceplanes.

So most likely some issues with settings.
Is the second attempt in career mode? You have to unlock the modules in that one whereas in sandbox they’re all available.

6 hours ago, Curveball Anders said:

No.

I use it for most of my landings and I don't use spaceplanes.

So most likely some issues with settings.

oh right I was thinking about aircraft approach and auto land.
